
Essentially, the original miner agent wasn't really meant to be restarted. It is using the classical `close(quit)` paradigm to signal children goroutines of the stop, but this is not workable if you intend to restart the thing, as you'll need locks all over the place to protect every possible scheduling variation since you're creating and destroying channels concurrently.

We'll need to figure out a different mechanism to handle the restarts.
